creator: Boulton, Charles Arkell (author)
description: Boulton, Charles Arkell: 1841-1899. Born in Ontario; served in Imperial army until 1868; went to Red River Settlement and during the rebellion was imprisoned by Riel, 1869-1870; returned to Ontario, but again settled in Manitoba at Shellmouth; raised a cavalry unit "Boulton's Scouts" which he commanded during the Rebellion, 1885; appointed to the Senate, 1889; fifteen variations in the spelling of Arkell are known (Morgan, Canadian men and women of the time, 1898) // On pages 499-531: "List of officers and men comprising the North-West Field Force which suppressed the Rebellion of 1885." Also published, [s.l.: s.n., 1886?] (469p.); edited and abridged by Heather Robertson as I fought Riel: A military memoir , Toronto: James Lorimer, 1985 (xvi, 225p.).
format: [4], [vi], 1 leaf, [7]-531 p., port., illus., plates, plans, map.; 18.5 cm.

title: Reminiscences of the North-West Rebellions: With a record of the raising of Her Majesty's 100th Regiment in Canada, and a chapter on Canadian social & political life
